comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Aha! Finally, an LOC upload with local import for my town! I live in Redondo Beach, CA; and so did R. J. Burdette--his house "Eventide" was still standing when I moved here, but it was demolished in 1999: www.redondobeachhistorical.org/theburdettehouse.htm www.redondobeachhistorical.org/Eventide.htm Robert Jones Burdette (1844-1914) was a Civil War vet, a Baptist minister, humorist, and writer: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Jones_Burdette

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca: Thanks for the interesting history on Robert Jones Burdette's house in Redondo Beach. A photo that confirms that this photo depicts him can be found in a book published by his wife Clara (Robert J. Burdette; his message), that can be seen here: www.archive.org/stream/hismessage00burdrich#page/n5/mode/2up

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Hi, Penny -- do you happen to know my wife's daughter? She also lives in Redondo Beach.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: No, but it's a pretty big city for a beach town.  Interesting name for a seaside denizen!
